The Robertson Media Center, based on the 3rd floor of Clemons Library, offers a variety of studios and technology spaces to support student and faculty exploration.

Find spaces to engage with audio, video, digital fabrication, or virtual reality, and learn how to use media to enrich your scholarship, your classroom, and beyond!

RMC spaces include…

Studio & Creation Spaces
These rooms are outfitted for all kinds of audio and video projects. Come check them out!
Immersive VR
Two HTC Vive stations for VR instruction, creation, and demonstration.
3D Printing Studio
The 3D Printing Studio houses 7 printers that (after a quick training) are free and open to anyone at the University!
Classroom spaces
The G-Lab Classroom is perfect for media classes, and the VizWall lounge area is unbeatable for groups, demonstrations, and special media events.

Browse all RMC spaces

Clemons Library, which houses the Robertson Media Center, is also home to multiple reservable classroom and group spaces.

Browse RMC spaces

Use Policies

Access to RMC resources is generally limited to University of Virginia students, staff, and faculty. Exceptions for public community patrons may be granted on a case-by-case basis, related to academic projects or special events.

Questions? Contact teachlearn@virginia.edu, we’re happy to help!
